intro: Tarenna obtusifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved tarenna, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its simple, opposite, and ovate leaves with a smooth upper surface. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that turn from green to red when mature. Tarenna obtusifolia is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
